Class StringParamController

  • java.lang.Object
    • uws.job.parameters.StringParamController
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    InputParamController

    public class StringParamController
extends java.lang.Object
implements InputParamController
    Let controlling a String parameter.
    Version:
    4.1 (09/2014)
    Author:
    Grégory Mantelet (CDS;ARI)

    • Constructor Detail

      • StringParamController

        public StringParamController(java.lang.String paramName)
        Builds a controller of the specified String parameter.
        Parameters:
        paramName - Name of the controlled parameter.
        See Also:
        StringParamController(String, String, String[], boolean)

      • StringParamController

        public StringParamController(java.lang.String paramName,
                     java.lang.String defaultValue,
                     java.lang.String[] possibleValues,
                     boolean allowModif)
        Builds a controller of the specified String parameter and configures it.
        Parameters:
        paramName - Name of the controlled parameter.
        defaultValue - Default value of this parameter. note: It may be NULL. If the next parameter is not NULL or empty, the default value must be one of its values.
        possibleValues - List of all allowed values. note: It may be NULL or empty. In this case, any value is allowed.
        allowModif - true to allow the modification of the specified parameter after its initialization, false otherwise.

    • Method Detail

      • getDefaultValue

        public final java.lang.String getDefaultValue()
        Gets the default value of the parameter.
        Returns:
        The default value. (MAY BE NULL)

        public final void setDefaultValue(java.lang.String defaultValue)
        Sets the default value of the parameter.
        Parameters:
        defaultValue - The new default value. (MAY BE NULL)

      • getPossibleValues

        public final java.lang.String[] getPossibleValues()
        Gets the list of all allowed values.
        Returns:
        The allowed values. note: If NULL or empty, any value is allowed.

      • setPossibleValues

        public final void setPossibleValues(java.lang.String[] possibleValues)
        Sets the list of all allowed values.
        Parameters:
        possibleValues - The new allowed values. note: If NULL or empty, any value is allowed.

      • check

        public java.lang.Object check(java.lang.Object value)
                       throws UWSException
        Description copied from interface: InputParamController

        Checks the value of the controlled parameter and builds a new object from this value.

        Specified by:
        check in interface InputParamController
        Parameters:
        value - Parameter value to check.
        Returns:
        The same value or a new object built from the given value.
        Throws:
        UWSException - If the given value is strongly incorrect.

      • getExpectedFormat

        protected final java.lang.String getExpectedFormat()
        Gets a string which lists all the allowed values.
        Returns:
        A string which describes the format expected by this controller.
